help.title: Help / README
help.copyPromptSubText: Use this prompt with an AI (like Gemini, ChatGPT, etc.) to generate questions in the correct JSON format from your own texts or documents.
help.jsonFormatTitle: JSON Format for Questions and Flashcards
help.imageSupportIntro: Both quiz questions and flashcards can include images through the optional 'image' field.
features: Set Management: Save, load and delete different sets of questions or flashcards.
Single choice, multiple choice, matching (drag and drop) and fill-in-the-blanks (dropdowns) questions.
Flashcards with front/back and intuitive navigation.
Random shuffling of questions and options/terms when loading and retrying (within the active set).
Question and Flashcard (JSON) editing of the active set.

howToUseSteps.title: Manage Sets (in "Set Editor")
subSteps: Use the dropdown and "Load Selected Set" button to choose which set of questions to use in the quiz and edit.
Use the "Delete Selected Set" button to delete a set (except the default one).
Use the "Reset 'Example Questions'" button to return to the original version of that specific set.

howToUseSteps.title: Edit Questions (in "Set Editor")
subSteps: The textarea shows the JSON of the currently loaded set.
Modify the JSON. Be careful with syntax and unique IDs!
Use "Save Changes" to update the current set (doesn't work with the default set).
Enter a name and use "Save as New Set" to create a new set with the editor content. This new set will become the active one.

howToUseSteps.title: Answer (in "Quiz")
howToUseSteps.description: Answer the questions from the active set. Drag terms to definitions to match. Select options in dropdowns to fill blanks. Click "Submit Answers".

howToUseSteps.title: View Results
howToUseSteps.description: Score and feedback will be shown for the active set.

howToUseSteps.title: Retry
howToUseSteps.description: Use "Try Again" to restart the quiz *with the same active set* (shuffled again).

help.jsonFormatDescription: Each set is an array of JSON objects. Each object must have a unique id key within that set.
flashcardFormatList: id: Unique identifier for the flashcard (string, e.g. "fc1").
front: Front content of the card (question, term or concept).
back: Back content of the card (answer, definition or explanation).
image (optional): Image in base64 format or data URL.
quizQuestionFormatList: id: Unique identifier for the question (string, e.g. "q1").
question: Question text or sentence with blanks (string).
singleTypeList: correctAnswer: String of the correct answer.
multipleTypeList: correctAnswers: Array of strings with the correct answers.
matchingTypeList: terms: Array of strings (terms to drag).
correctMatches: Object with two possible formats:
‚Ä¢ Format 2 (multiple terms): { definition: [term1, term2] } or { definition: term }
fillInTheBlanksList: question: String with text and placeholders like [BLANK_ID].
blanks: Object where each key is a BLANK_ID (without brackets) from the text.
Each value in blanks is an object with:
fillInTheBlanksSubList: options: Array of strings (options for that blank).
correctAnswer: String of the correct answer for that blank.
imageSupportFormatList: Supported types: JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP, SVG
imageGuidelinesList: Keep images under 2MB for optimal performance
Use relevant images that complement educational content
Consider accessibility: images will be displayed with alt text
Images are automatically resized to fit the container
